features: How to install the sponge head: Aim at the groove, use your strength to insert the iron clamp on the sponge head into the groove. And if you want to remove the sponge head, pull the ring on the mop head out.
Sponge Mop Honeycomb Sponge: Honeycombed sponge design is more absorbent, easier to dry and stronger breathability.
Sponge Mop Adjustable Iron Pole: The handle can be adjusted from 42.5 inch to 52 inch. Anticlockwise screw the middle pole to adjust the length of the mop to your desire.
Sponge Mop Water Squeegee: There is a squeegee that can help you to clean dirt and water in a easier and faster way.
Sponge Mop Removable Sponge: The sponge section can be easily removed and installed, and you can remove it for thorough cleaning or storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and Useful
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use mop! Some minor dis-asswmbly required because you have to pry the plastic from out and around the sponge end that comes already mounted. Great tool and so helpful for the floors. The cieling window has a leak and when it rains we dry mop it up with this from the tile floor and squeeze it out into the sink. Works like a charm!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Be careful about removing the mophead
reviews.reviewText: I think this a great mop and I plan to buy replacement heads for it. I haven't figured out how to use the squeegee effectively because it seems like the other parts of it make it difficult to use that part. I accidentally broke the first mophead by trying to insert it in backwards. So pay attention to that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, adjustable, built to last.
reviews.reviewText: Believe it or not I spent quite a bit of time researching mops on Amazon before choosing this one. My motivation? Really grew to dislike buying mops at the grocery store that seem to last only a year or so before the plastic sponge holder breaks. I have been using sponge-head mops for years and was about to buy one of the newer pad-style mops when I came across this one. I was glad because I'm not really sure I'm on board with the pad-style mops. I've been using this for almost six months now.This mop fits the bill for many of the features I wanted:Quality materials - I'm a guy and this mop doesn't disappoint here. Feels quite sturdy and well-made. HINT - one thing I've learned is to change my use of bleach. I used to use a weak bleach solution on my linoleum floor because I found bleach allowed me to get a lot more mileage out of my sponges (I'm guessing because bleach killed bacteria that would otherwise grow in the damp sponge and break it down). What I forgot to consider is that dunking a mop into a bleach solution would eventually cause corrosion where the steel handle met the plastic sponge holder. At some point if the plastic holder didn't give out first, the handle would eventually break at that corroded point. This company rightly warns to avoid using bleach, but what I've done is switch to dish soap for the linoleum floor and I still hit the sponge with a weak bleach solution after each mopping session to extend the life of the sponge. I make sure to rinse thoroughly with clean water to remove the bleach residue from the sponge and plastic rollers that serve to squeeze excess water from the sponge. This way I kind of get the best of both worlds.Height-adjustable - I'm 6' 2" and it's really nice to be able to extend this thing out to the max so I'm not bent over at all during use. The grocery store mops (at least in my area) NEVER have this feature.Wringing mechanism - Again, quality materials here. Very easy to wring and no worries I'm going to break the plastic sponge holder using brute force like with the clamshell-style sponge mops I've used for years. Also, the handle for the wringer is located higher up on the mop handle so it's less awkward wringing the mop.Squeegee/brush attachment - I haven't used it much in practice and I actually keep it off the mop because I hang the it on a wall in a high traffic area and it sticks out too much with the attachment (but I would keep it on otherwise). For me, the squeegee in particular is a nice option to have.I had no problem assembling this and the instructions were fairly clear as I recall, but I'm also pretty handy and I could see some people having some trouble with assembly. Overall, I am really happy with this mop. I bought with 3 sponges and don't foresee needing any more for quite some time even with weekly use. The only thing I like a bit less about this mop is the sponges themselves are a more open-celled type than I typically used in the past. I have to wring the sponge more than once or it applies more water than I prefer. I think this is necessary because the roller-style wringing mechanism likely would not work as well with a denser sponge. My only other concern is how long I'll be able to get sponge refills because I think this mop is going to last for some years. That's a good problem to have in my book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great customer service
reviews.reviewText: I've used this mop 4 times, at first it was great, but now I can't get the extension pole to come out so my mop is permanently stuck in the shortest setting. When I go to try and unscrew to pull the extension pole out, it just turns and turns and turns, but won't let me pull the pole out any further. So basically this mop is useless because I can't mop my floors when the mop only comes up to my hips. Of course I am out of the return window, and I don't see an option to contact the seller. I've looked. I was really excited to buy this mop, but there goes $20 down the drain. Extremely disappointed!**** After I posted my review, the company reached out to me and sent me another mop, I am updating my review to five stars because of the great customer service. I really respect a business that strives to make their customers happy and go that extra mile!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for.
reviews.reviewText: Decent value. Use sparingly as the sponge mop seems pretty flimsy and tore after about 20 uses. Also, while I appreciate the telescoping pole, it also seemed like if I applied real muscle, that I could break the plastic pole. However I would be reluctant to recommend to a friend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Head mop stuck!
reviews.reviewText: I cannot understand why when they put the mop head on they left all the plastic wrapping on? It got everything so jammed up I could not get it off without unscrewing some screws to loosen it up some. A waste of an hour of my time. Still not that easy to change the mop. Maybe after some use with the soap and water will make it easier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well made, great design
reviews.reviewText: It's a better sponge mop than I've seen in any retail store. Very well made

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great sponge! Easy to wring handle.
reviews.reviewText: This mop cleaned really well.Rinsed clean easily.I like how it has the scrub brush and squeegee side.I would have given a 5 star review ifIt was a one piece handle. I'm not a huge fan of the twist together stuff.Then again I do a lot of heavy duty scrubbing.My kitchen floor is cleaner then it's been in a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good mop, lightweight and cleans like a beast!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to assemble, came extremely quick (next day) very durable and lightweight

reviews.reviewTitle: Le bon utile pour mes sols
reviews.reviewText: Pour lavez les sols carrelés. Mon ancien éponge était usé et pas encore en vente. J'ai essayé un nouveau balai/ éponge mais c'était trop dur et pas absorbant, même après trempage. Enfin j'ai trouvé le Yocada Vadrouille éponge Mop" , qui est le bon utile pour les taches.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 30, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I really found this mop easy to use and I am very pleased with the results.

Arrivato con un giorno di anticipo ben imballato. Il montaggio è facile, bisogna avvitare i 3 pezzi di manico e poi fissare la spugna infilandola nella guida, bisogna forzare leggermente, ma non è difficile. Prima di usarlo ho ammorbidito la spugna con acqua calda e poi ho cominciato a usarla. Non che avessi grandi aspettative, alla fine è una specie di mocio, ma rispetto a quest'ultimo porta in giro molti meno Peretti e sporcizia. In pochi minuti ho pulito i pavimenti e sono rimasta soddisfatta. Bisogna solo usare detersivi non tanto schiumosi perché la spugna strizzandola tende a fare schiuma.
Benutze den Wischschwamm um meinen Ruderkahn fix zu reinigen... endlich ohne nasse, schmutzige Hände! Funktioniert prima, wirkt alles stabil.
